product_name: Good MoleculesHydrating Gel Moisturizer with Electrolytes
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackDeliver nutrients to the skin while helping hydrate, balance, and smooth the complexion with this oil-free Hydrating Gel Moisturizer with Electrolytes from Good Molecules.
details: DetailsBenefitsOil-free moisturizing gel texture to hydrate and replenish the skin with electrolytes and osmolytes.Pseudoalteromonas Ferment Extract is mattifying and hydrating to help balance the complexion and reduce skin oiliness.Notice fewer blemishes and smoother skin with continued use.Item 2630332How To UseGently massage gel onto skin. Let fully absorb before applying other products. Suitable for daily use. For external use. Avoid eye area.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Propanediol, Glycerin, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Carrageenan, Sea Salt, Pseudoalteromonas Ferment Extract, Sodium Levulinate, Xylitol, Betaine, Inositol, Ectoin, Sodium Benzoate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Xanthan Gum, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Pentylene Glycol, Hydroxyacetophenone, Magnesium Aspartate, Zinc Gluconate, Citric Acid, Arginine, Copper Gluconate, Sodium Hyaluronate.
how_to_use: Gently massage gel onto skin. Let fully absorb before applying other products. Suitable for daily use. For external use. Avoid eye area.

reviews.headline: Not a good mousterizer
reviews.comments: This mousterizer doesn't break out my skin or otherwise give me a bad reaction, but it's more like a serum. I have to use about a teaspoon every morning and night (yikes) for it to remotely hydrate my skin. Even then it doesn't feel like enough.

reviews.headline: Burns and peels
reviews.comments: I have oily acne prone skin this made my face burn and peel.

reviews.headline: Yes but more so a serum
reviews.comments: I really like the product. I have combo skin, i use this after i wash my face in the morning before spf, I've found that my skin doesn't get as oily. I probably only use it hotter months, it wont be enough hydration for winter.

reviews.headline: Wanted to love…
reviews.comments: I was very excited when this first launched as i have a combo skin type. The oil-free, water based formula seemed like a good fit for me at first. Unfortunately, this product does not work well with others, even with GM products. I was really disappointed by the performance as it does feel hydrating when applied. I have dealt with breakouts and pilling since purchasing. I hope GM reformulates this product, as I believe it can be improved.

reviews.headline: Don't get it
reviews.comments: It's honestly does nothing, it feels like water going on the face and drying. My skin honestly felt more dry after using this. Would only recommend if you are very oily prone

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: Again, it feels nice! Its just very thin and it pills when you put another product on top of it like sunscreen.

reviews.headline: Best For Oily Acne Prone Skin
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is the only one I have found that doesn't cause breakouts or irritate my sensitive skin. I tend to be oily but using a face wash without a moisturizer makes my skin angry.  I have tried so many affordable moisturizers Cetaphil,  crave, la.roche,, byoma, and countless others. This is it. It also initially is a little tacky so I wonder how it will fair under makeup.  I've been using it for about a month now but haven't had energy to do a full makeup look but it sits well under sunscreen and concealer.  For the winter time I'll likely go back to the Ordinary moisturizer because that, too, works well buts it's way too heavy for the summer months. (Also the ordinary lightweight gel irritates my skin, it's only the medium level moisturizer). All in all if you are oily and acne prone and don't want a moisturizer that sits on your skin give this a shot.

reviews.headline: Would not repurchase
reviews.comments: This moisturizer is THIN and did absolutely nothing for my skin. My skin is combo with an oily Tzone for reference. I knew after the first use this would be a dud product but I used it for a solid week to fully test it out. I had to go over my skin within an hour with another gel moisturizer because it did nothing for my skin. Don't waste your time!

reviews.headline: meh
reviews.comments: I have combination skin and have been breaking out heavily in my T-zone so I've been looking for something gentle to balance my dry patches on my cheeks with my oily areas. I could see this being good for someone with oily skin all over, but unfortunately it just hasn't been enough for my dry patches. I've also tried the lotion form of their daily mosturizer and that one felt too thick so... onto the next lol.

reviews.headline: I would not buy this product again
reviews.comments: Did not feel moisturizing at all. The consistency is very thin, almost like an oil. Would not repurchase.

reviews.headline: Great Product
reviews.comments: This is WONDERFUL for oily/combination skin 12/10 would recommend!

reviews.headline: It's okay
reviews.comments: For being someone with oily skin, it still doesn't hydrate my skin enough and i feel i need a lot to see some sort of moisture, its not terrible to use but its not my favorite

reviews.headline: Only for oily ppl
reviews.comments: I have pretty oily skin on general but especially in the summer (I live in humid VA) so it works for me! I don't see a way anyone else could use this lol even if you have combo skin this still might be too lightweight for you in the summer. Calling it a gel is a stretch I think it's more like a serum which is honestly great for my skin in the summer. I gave it 4 starts cuz I feel like this won't be good when I use something really drying on my face like benzoyl peroxide and it probably won't work for me during most other seasons

reviews.headline: i think not
reviews.comments: i really wanted to lile this but it foams up on my fave ive tried many different techniques and still suds up like soap and dosnt deliver hydration honestly

reviews.headline: I returned this
reviews.comments: wasn't hydrating, didn't JUST break me out but killed my skin barrier & triggered my roseaca to flare up. I'm on day 7 of healing my face. (I have oily, acne prone, roseaca sensitive skin)

reviews.headline: It was good til it wasn't
reviews.comments: I bought this to try it out because I have oily skin. The first couple of days it was doing pretty well then one time i noticed extreme redness in my chin and around the lip area. Also more pimples were forming as well. You can try it out for yourself but i personally wouldn't recommend

reviews.headline: My skin loves it
reviews.comments: I've been using this for a few weeks and it has definitely made a difference in my routine. My esthetician recommended a non-oil moisturizer and I already knew to check if Good molecules had one before looking at any other brand. I trust their ingredients!

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: I really wanted to like this product. Upon application it feels very hydrating but after a couple of minutes my skin feels tight. I also noticed pilling when I put on my makeup and that never happens. After a couple of days I also notice some pimples starting to form.

reviews.headline: Good for oily skin
reviews.comments: This moisterizer is nice! I have dry skin, so while this wasn't hydrating enough for me, I like to use it when my skin is breaking out or my pores are more clogged than normal.

reviews.headline: Not a bad product, but not for me.
reviews.comments: It wasn't bad, but it wasnt enough hydration for my skin. It was nice for layering with another moisturizer or sunscreen (and it didn't pill) but alone, my skin felt smooth but still tight and dry. My skin has a couple pretty rough dry spots though since I use a very potent prescription retinol for acne. I ended up returning it but you might enjoy it if you have oily skin.

media.headline: This is a new must-have for my skincare routine!!

faceoff_positive.comments: This moisturizer is the only one I have found that doesn't cause breakouts or irritate my sensitive skin. I tend to be oily but using a face wash without a moisturizer makes my skin angry.  I have tried so many affordable moisturizers Cetaphil,  crave, la.roche,, byoma, and countless others. This is it. It also initially is a little tacky so I wonder how it will fair under makeup.  I've been using it for about a month now but haven't had energy to do a full makeup look but it sits well under sunscreen and concealer.  For the winter time I'll likely go back to the Ordinary moisturizer because that, too, works well buts it's way too heavy for the summer months. (Also the ordinary lightweight gel irritates my skin, it's only the medium level moisturizer). All in all if you are oily and acne prone and don't want a moisturizer that sits on your skin give this a shot.

Unfortunately, this product does not work well with others, even with GM products. I was really disappointed by the performance as it does feel hydrating when applied. I have dealt with breakouts and pilling since purchasing. I hope GM reformulates this product, as I believe it can be improved.
faceoff_negative.headline: Wanted to love…
